ICW: Tak Keluarkan Perppu, Desain Pelemahan KPK Berasal dari Jokowi
02 Nov 2019, 07:04 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) kecewa dengan Presiden Jokowi karena tidak menerbitkan peraturan pemerintah pengganti UU (Perppu) nomor 19/2019 tentang KPK. ICW menyebut Jokowi dan juga DPR berupaya melemahkan KPK.
"Pertama, ICW kecewa dengan sikap presiden yang sudah memutuskan tidak mengeluarkan Perppu KPK. Ini sebenarnya mengonfirmasi, desain lemah untuk melemahkan KPK memang berasal dari presiden dan juga DPR karena opsi yang paling memungkinkan untuk menyelamatkan KPK, memang ada judicial review, tapi JR butuh waktu yang cukup panjang," kata peneliti ICW Kurnia Ramadhana kepada wartawan, Jumat (1/11/2019).
ICW menilai Jokowi abai atas aspirasi masyarakat. Elemen masyarakat seperti mahasiswa sebelumnya menggelar demo di sejumlah kota untuk menuntut Jokowi menerbitkan Perppu KPK karena sejumlah pasal di UU KPK yang baru dinilai sarat kontroversi.
"Sedangkan di sisi lain UU KPK yang baru sudah berlaku dan proses penegakkan hukum di KPK dipastikan akan melambat akibat dari UU KPK yang baru sehingga Perppu merupakan cara tepat. Presiden tidak mengeluarkan Perppu hari ini mengonfirmasi bahwa presiden mengabaikan masukan masyarakat," kata Kurnia.
Penegasan Jokowi untuk tidak mengeluarkan Perppu KPK saat ia dipastikan akan melantik Dewan Pengawas KPK. Jokowi beralasan, dirinya menunggu sidang uji materi (judicial review) di Mahkamah Konstitusi (MK).
"Kita melihat bahwa sekarang ini masih ada proses uji materi di MK. Kita harus menghargai proses-proses seperti itu. Jangan ada orang yang masih berproses, uji materi, kemudian langsung ditimpa keputusan lain. Saya kira kita harus tahu sopan santun dalam bertata negara," ujar Jokowi di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta Pusat, Jumat (1/11).

(dkp/aik)

ICW: Not Issuing Perppu, Design of KPK Weakening Derived from Jokowi
02 Nov 2019, 07:04 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) is disappointed with President Jokowi for not issuing a government regulation in lieu of Law (Perppu) number 19/2019 regarding the KPK. ICW said that Jokowi and also the Parliament were trying to weaken the KPK.
"First, ICW is disappointed with the attitude of the president who has decided not to issue a Perppu on the KPK. This actually confirms that the weak design to weaken the KPK came from the president and also the House of Representatives because the most possible option to save the KPK, there is indeed a judicial review, but JR takes time which is quite long, "ICW researcher Kurnia Ramadhana told reporters on Friday (11/01/2019).
ICW considers Jokowi to be ignorant of people's aspirations. Community elements such as students had previously held demonstrations in a number of cities to demand that Jokowi issue a KPPU Perppu because a number of articles in the new KPK Law were deemed full of controversy.
"Whereas on the other hand the new KPK Law is already in force and the law enforcement process at the KPK is certain to slow down as a result of the new KPK Law so the Perppu is the right way. The President did not issue a Perppu today confirming that the president ignored public input," Kurnia said.
Jokowi's assertion not to issue a Perppu on the KPK when he was certain it would appoint the KPK Supervisory Board. Jokowi reasoned, he was waiting for a judicial review session in the Constitutional Court (MK).
"We see that currently there is still a material testing process at the Constitutional Court. We must respect such processes. Do not have people who are still processing, material testing, then other decisions are immediately overwritten. I think we should know manners in the state administration, "Jokowi said at the Merdeka Palace, Central Jakarta, Friday (1/11).
